cheers plux
Flash does work in wine, I've run it myself. The best way to get it running is to go to System > Administration > Synaptic Package Manager and search for 'wine'
If you want the latest and greatest version (though the Synaptic version should be good enough), copy and paste the two lines from http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb
To install Ming, just go to Synaptics and search for ming
If Wine doesn't work for you, you can try Virtualbox and run Windows from _inside_ Ubuntu.
you say run windows from "inside" ubuntu - can I use the version of xp on my other hard disk?
Yes, if both HDs are on the same PC.
You can allocate the memory you want for it.
Actually, I don't know if Virtualbox will allow this, but VMWare, a commercial virtualization, will.
If you have 256, you'll have a tough time running it.
It's possible, but 128 for Ubuntu and 128 for Windows is stretching it.
